reviews.review_msg: Took this class Distance Ed and it was fairly easy. Online discussions are easy marks. Aim to do well on the papers because it will significantly help your grade going into the final. The text book will only really be utilized to study for the final. Like any class, do well on the papers and know the material for the final and you will do very well
Took through distance education. Overall great course. The exams are straightforward.

Online. Covers a large range of world religions. Aim to do really good on the 2 papers and make sure to participate in both discussions by the due date.. This way you don't have too much pressure for the final (definitions, 2 short essays, and 2 big essays, no MC). Helped to have a higher grade going into the exam. Minimal work, good class

Took it DE. This class should be noted as a W class: 2 papers & the Final (no MT) is strictly written, but you do get the essay question beforehand. Discussions were easy. I had a fairly rude TA (Michael) who kind of talked down to students, but he was frequently available. Maybe it's the way he writes messages?
Brilliant woman!
20% Participation? Yikes...But really nice prof. Be prepared to be called on every class if you have her in your tutorials and even sometime randomly in the giant lecture hall.

I took this class in the spring 2010 semester. The prof was clear and always tried to engage the class in her morning discussions. If you are looking for a class where you do not have to put a lot of effort in, then this is not the class for you. If you know nothing about religion and do not study for the exams, you will probably fail the course.
very knowledgeable prof. really cares about her students. quizzes can be challenging because they are m/c. I learned a lot.  I really enjoyed my first humanities class.
She was my field school director for Prague, and she made it the best experience I've ever had. Highly intellectual, caring, and thoughtful. It was a privilege to be her student.

I had this course online it was good. I had a really dumb TA and then contacted christine to get my work remarked and she moved me from a B to a A! Shes a really nice prof and this course is fun and really opens your mind. Everyone should take this course it relates to so many other subjects

Not taking anything away from her as a prof but the class is simply to broad to cover all major religions. Moreover, the marking is extremely subjective.  Religion spans outside the realm of academia and the authenticity of scholars in religion outside academia have to be taken into account.  This is where Prof Jones and I disagreed.
Truly an amazing prof. She is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about humanities! It was a pleasure to learn from her.

Christine Jones is a really helpful professor! I find that she did cover the material very quickly in lectures, but if you have her as your tutorial leader, she can cover things in great detail. I enjoyed this class and I highly recommend taking her classes.
I love Chris.  She is such a wonderful professor and human being.  You'd have to be incredibly lazy or one-dimensional not to like her/her courses.

I have found Dr. Jones to be one of the most engaging professors at SFU. She really takes an interest in her students' well being, and understands that her assigments are not the only assignments a student gets.
Amazing prof! Would take another class with her (Y)
One of the best Profs I've ever had. Nice, helpful, and passionate. Even talking with her would make you feel better. Highly recommended Prof for this course!!!

Professor Jones was okay. She did not explain all concepts that well. Went a bit too fast. She skips around a lot so it is hard to keep up with what she is talking about. I didn't really enjoy her class.

Such an amazing prof. this was the first humanities class I ever took and I learned so much in her seminars. Even though it's 4 hours long, the discussions are good so it seems shorter than some of my 2 hour lectures.

Excellent prof, small intimate classes, like maybe 150 people. Great tutorials lots of discussion shes SO open mided got A's on all my essays. Read the books, they're interesting and not difficult to understand. Shes a one in a million prof, really cares and has a GREAT TA Michael!
So great to talk to one on one. Really good memory for faces.
She is one the best profs I've ever had. Very well-organized, friendly, helpful, and fair marker.
Took this DE and it was okay. Didn't have any contact with the professor, only with the tutor-marker. Didn't do much work and got a decent mark.
Awesome

Christine Jones is the most kind professor I've seen at SFU. She makes you read a lot of books, but she's definitely there to listen to you and help you out along the way. I don't like humanities, but I really enjoyed her class.

I would take anything that Chris was teaching. This course was excellent, though it should be noted that it is not a World Religions course but a Religious Studies one. Emphasis on the philosophy behind religions and the questions they bring forth/try to answer. Very interesting, lots of discussion, one paper and a final exam.

One of the best profs I've ever had!  Well-organized, friendly, open-minded and helpful.  Hum. 101 is more philosophical and theoretical (requiring lots of reading) so here's a warning to those who doesn't like reading/or philosophy, otherwise, she's definitely a great prof to have!  :)
LOVE HER!  She is so wonderful, intelligent and caring; I was excited to go to class every week.

Chris is a great teacher. I think she does her best with her upper division classes though. I find it difficult to agree with comments like: "this course had too many things to read or do" because one must remember that Hum 101W is a Writing intensive course, hence the W. You chose it so don't complain about it. Overall, great prof!
Dr. Jones is a good prof, very helpful, wants the best for her students... even though I got a D. Workload is quite a bit also.

Tied (with Brook) as my favorite prof in the Humanities department. She does best in 200 level classes where she can interact with the students. She's low stress, fair with tests and discussion and provokes great thoughts in the process. HIGHLY recommended.
Cris is a great Prof but the course was a lot of work... many complex concepts to deal with!
Awesome!~
chris will continue to inspire many
quite boring class..but she tries her best.

Chris is amazing.  She is so caring and wants the best for her students.  She's a great teacher, structures her classes well, and really knows her material; but, even more important than that, she is so inspiring.  She makes you want to learn more and do well.

I LOVE HER! If you go see her in her office hours she'll be glad o help you.I was writing an essay and I went to her about my thesis, She told me mine wasn't very good and we rewrote it together. Totaly helped me so much.
Chris is one of the best teachers you can get at SFU. If you like reading and enjoy super interesting conversations during class, you must take one of her classes.
I had to try not to fall asleep many times
Chris herself is great but I found the class material got too complex considering it is  a 1st year course

Wonderful person, really interesting course esp. readings. A lot of work but work is enjoyable. You really feel u r learning smthg important. U always know exactly what is expected of you. Only complaint: wish she would share more of her knowledge instead of always leaving it to class discussion. Take this course with Chris!
I loved this course! It was a lot of work but it was also worth it - I learned SO much. I think everyone should have to take this course in order to be an intelligent informed citizen.

I didn't feel that this course was extremely difficult as some people say, however, you have to be interested in the course work because there are some really tricky concepts to know.  chris on the other hand is a wonderful, helpful, and an easily accessible prof who made my first semester as a university student a bit easier.

Would not recommend this course if you do not do well in English. Prof talks about the author and gives background info about the text but doesn't talk about/explain the text itself. TA's are good. If you know how to write a good essay and understand what you are reading, go for it

Good proff.  Yeah, you guys are right, definitely not a first year...no we mean high school class.  That's university.  Most proffs will give you as many books but make you read full texts, not a few chapters.  At least that's what you get with any descent prof in the humanities.

Chris is a nice, intelligent prof but the course didn't work well. 1 hour lectures did not give enough time to properly cover reading material.  Would have been better with 2hr. lectures and half as many readings.  Lectures at 8:30am probably didnt help either.  Notes for lectures posted online were not helpful

do not take this class unless u feel u can handle the work load. also as the people below have mentioned. this is not a first year class although it is listed as a 100 level course. be advised you will be reading and writing heavily. and make sure to tank those wonderful ta's at the end of semester.
NOT a first year class. A lot of reading and difficult concepts. This class made my brain hurt. Chris is nice and clear, but the class is really tough.

Chris is very intelligent, warm, and approachable. She genuinely cares about her students, and facilites great discussion in lecture and tutorial. If you are interested in the subject, take this class with her.

pretty mellow proff... cool accent, hard to understand her though. definetly not first year class. the work load is major. the book list is major and hard to understand. if it weren't for the TA's i would no diddly

I took this course a few semesters ago. It was awesome, really interesting. I like the Prof b/c she is kind, accessible, and interested in course material. She was a hard worker and is an intelligent individual.
This class is definetly not for a first year student. Shes okay but i think she has a fake accent... SHE SAYS UMANS INSTEAD OF HUMANS
Easy class that was interessting.....chris was very helpful if you needed it

really nice teacher. her lectures are not he most informative & tutorials are just discussion, but a fun class with lots of movies. also everything that was going to be on the final was given out about 2 weeks in advance, so easy to know exactly what to study. great professor.

Professor Jones is one of best profs. The class is pretty easy, she gives you easy quizzes which only test whether u read the material or not, there are no trick questions, etc. Show up to class, take notes, and study her lecture notes for final and you will do fine.
She is interested in what she is teaching. However, she is not very good at teaching it. We spent all of our lectures having discussions so it was hard to know what she would be testing on the final.
Dr. Jones is great.  I hope the finals in future classes are not worth quite as much.

Her first semester at SFU, I think her biggest downfall was adjusting the course content so now we're trying to cover too much stuff in one lecture.  I really like the open talking she encourages and she really knows her stuff.  I think next semester she'll be great once she gets comfortable
No Comments
